p: Parasitic gastrointestinal nematodes lead to an adverse impact on health and productivity in livestock, thus causing huge economic losses worldwide. The blood-sucking parasite Haemonchus contortus is in particular the predominant pathogenic endoparasite of small ruminants [ 1]. Nowadays, various trace elements or herbal nutraceuticals which have anthelmintic properties and can be successfully serve as an alternative to chemical control of parasites have been identified [ 2, 3, 4].
